page.title: 04PAGHAM NATURE RESERVE
page.content: In the estuary there is a rich form of soil type,full of living organisms.Here we find some rare plants e.g.the childing pink. There is an area of marshland and intertidal mudflats which is totally covered with sea water at high tide.It is rich in salt marsh plants and there is a small wood and 16 acres of reed beds. The Bird Sanctuary was established in 1964 in order to protect the little tern.The hedgerow bushes and shingle bank are there for the rare birds to nest in. Other visitors include the red shank,ringed plover and oyster catcher,the common tern,shell duck,brent geese and occasionally we see the avocet.No large scale fishing is allowed here in order to ensure that the birds have plenty to eat.
